item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "I distrust any advice that contains the words 'ought' or 'should'." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness. Armour yourself in it, and it will never be used to hurt you." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "forgiveness is not a single act, but a matter of constant practice" -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "The worst part of holding the memories is not the pain. It's the loneliness of it. Memories need to be shared." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description:
"I liked the feeling of love,' [Jonas] confessed. He glanced nervously at the speaker on the wall, reassuring himself that no one was listening. 'I wish we still had that,' he whispered. 'Of course,' he added quickly, 'I do understand that it wouldn't work very well. And that it's much better to be organized the way we are now. I can see that it was a dangerous way to live.'
...'Still,' he said slowly, almost to himself, 'I did like the light they made. And the warmth." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by L. M. Montgomery
item.description: "I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers." -- L. M. Montgomery

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "She said she usually cried at least once each day not because she was sad, but because the world was so beautiful & life was so short." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "Time stands still best in moments that look suspiciously like ordinary life." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "Everything changed the day she figured out there was exactly enough time for the important things in her life." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "I sometimes wake in the early morning & listen to the soft breathing of my child & I think to myself, this is one thing I will never regret & I carry that quiet with me all day long." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "there are things you do because they feel right and they may make no sense and they may make no money and it may be the real reason we are here: to love each other and to eat each other's cooking and say it was good." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Tana French
item.description: "I read a lot. I always have, but in those two years I gorged myself on books with a voluptuous, almost erotic gluttony. I would go to the local library and take out as many as I could, and then lock myself in the bedsit and read solidly for a week. I went for old books, the older the better--Tolstoy, Poe, Jacobean tragedies, a dusty translation of Laclos--so that when I finally resurfaced, blinking and dazzled, it took me days to stop thinking in their cool, polished, crystalline rhythms." -- Tana French

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Everybody has a secret world inside of them. I mean everybody. All of the people in the whole world, I mean everybody — no matter how dull and boring they are on the outside. Inside them they've all got unimaginable, magnificent, wonderful, stupid, amazing worlds... Not just one world. Hundreds of them. Thousands, maybe." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "People think dreams aren't real just because they aren't made of matter, of particles. Dreams are real. But they are made of viewpoints, of images, of memories and puns and lost hopes." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I went away in my head, into a book. That was where I went whenever real life was too hard or too inflexible." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "And did I pass?" The face of the old woman on my right was unreadable in the gathering dusk. On my left the younger woman said, "You don't pass or fail at being a person, dear." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Adults follow paths. Children explore. Adults are content to walk the same way, hundreds of times, or thousands; perhaps it never occurs to adults to step off the paths, to creep beneath rhododendrons, to find the spaces between fences. I was a child, which meant that I knew a dozen different ways of getting out of our property and into the lane, ways that would not involve walking down our drive." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Once a little boy sent me a charming card with a little drawing on it. I loved it. I answer all my children’s letters — sometimes very hastily — but this one I lingered over. I sent him a card and I drew a picture of a Wild Thing on it. I wrote, “Dear Jim: I loved your card.” Then I got a letter back from his mother and she said, “Jim loved your card so much he ate it.” That to me was one of the highest compliments I’ve ever received. He didn’t care that it was an original Maurice Sendak drawing or anything. He saw it, he loved it, he ate it." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "There is not one big cosmic meaning for all; there is only the meaning we each give to our life, an individual meaning, an individual plot, like an individual novel, a book for each person." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx
